KH.content: in Timaeus, Greeks who have no writing (unlike Egyptians), need myth (destined to perpetual childhood) > memory of city, its salvation, entrusted to the writing of the other [who is the master here?]
KH.linkedContent: in Timaeus, Greeks who have no writing (unlike Egyptians), need myth (destined to perpetual childhood) > memory of city, its salvation, entrusted to the writing of the other [who is the master here?]

KH.content: [kind of Plato/Socrates Envois motif] Egypt tells childish Athens that it lacks the writing which it possesses, but whose invention Athens played the role of model
KH.linkedContent: [kind of Plato/Socrates Envois motif] Egypt tells childish Athens that it lacks the writing which it possesses, but whose invention Athens played the role of model

GT.content: writing not as the external archive of the gift, but tied to the very act of gift, act in sense of archive & performative operation
GT.linkedContent: writing not as the external archive of the gift, but tied to the very act of gift, act in sense of archive & performative operation

MONL.content: division, why one writes and how one dreams of writing, place of jealousy, divided btwn vengeance and resentment.
MONL.linkedContent: division, why one writes and how one dreams of writing, place of jealousy, divided btwn vengeance and resentment.

MONL.content: before any memory writing destines itself to anamnesia
MONL.linkedContent: before any memory writing destines itself to anamnesia

MONL.content: dreams of leaving marks that recall the entirely other prior-to-the-first language: degree zero-minus-one of memory. a desire for infinite salvation: scratch and graft, caress with claws, borrowed claws
MONL.linkedContent: dreams of leaving marks that recall the entirely other prior-to-the-first language: degree zero-minus-one of memory. a desire for infinite salvation: scratch and graft, caress with claws, borrowed claws

MONL.content: do I write in the promise of a sole poem, still unheard-of language? each time I speak or write, I promise
MONL.linkedContent: do I write in the promise of a sole poem, still unheard-of language? each time I speak or write, I promise

OOG.content: for Husserl, writing assures absolute traditionalization of object, does through virtuality, an autonomous transcendental field from which every present subject can be absent
OOG.linkedContent: for Husserl, writing assures absolute traditionalization of object, does through virtuality, an autonomous transcendental field from which every present subject can be absent

OOG.content: [Derrida now seems to hint at his own thought on writing] if text is not haunted by virtual intentionality, does not announce its pure dependence from writer/reader there’s no possibility of it being intelligible for a transcendental subject > silence, death, illegibility of past arcana, entombment of lost intentions and guarded secrets make possible privilege of intentionality
OOG.linkedContent: [Derrida now seems to hint at his own thought on writing] if text is not haunted by virtual intentionality, does not announce its pure dependence from writer/reader there’s no possibility of it being intelligible for a transcendental subject > silence, death, illegibility of past arcana, entombment of lost intentions and guarded secrets make possible privilege of intentionality

OOG.content: the de jure purity of intentional animation, for Husserl, as linguistic or graphic body is a flesh, proper body (Leib) or a spiritual corporeality (geistige Leiblichkeit)
OOG.linkedContent: the de jure purity of intentional animation, for Husserl, as linguistic or graphic body is a flesh, proper body (Leib) or a spiritual corporeality (geistige Leiblichkeit)

OOG.content: writing no longer only mnemotechnical aid, possibility of being incarnated in a graphic sign is condition of Objectivity’s internal completion
OOG.linkedContent: writing no longer only mnemotechnical aid, possibility of being incarnated in a graphic sign is condition of Objectivity’s internal completion

OOG.content: what Fink says about speech is true of writing, “in sensible embodiment occurs the ‘localization’ and the ‘temporalization’ of what is, by its being-sense, unlocated and untemporal”
OOG.linkedContent: what Fink says about speech is true of writing, “in sensible embodiment occurs the ‘localization’ and the ‘temporalization’ of what is, by its being-sense, unlocated and untemporal”

OOG.content: for Husserl, paradoxically, possibility of being written (possibilitié graphique) permits ultimate freeing of ideality
OOG.linkedContent: for Husserl, paradoxically, possibility of being written (possibilitié graphique) permits ultimate freeing of ideality

OOG.content: for Husserl, all factual writings in which truth could be sedimented nothing but sensible “exemplars,” they could all be destroyed w/out overtaking the very sense of absolute ideality
OOG.linkedContent: for Husserl, all factual writings in which truth could be sedimented nothing but sensible “exemplars,” they could all be destroyed w/out overtaking the very sense of absolute ideality

OOG.content: apriori structures of historicity could be questioned only by recourse to language, writing, the capacity of reactivation, and finally to method [this can be taken as Husserl’s method and as Derrida’s method]
OOG.linkedContent: apriori structures of historicity could be questioned only by recourse to language, writing, the capacity of reactivation, and finally to method [this can be taken as Husserl’s method and as Derrida’s method]

LOBL.content: what I still call “text” for strategic reasons, a differential network, a fabric of traces referring endlessly to something other than itself, to other differential traces, overruns its borders, all limits, everything set up in opposition to writing: speech, life, world, real, history, politics, economics
LOBL.linkedContent: what I still call “text” for strategic reasons, a differential network, a fabric of traces referring endlessly to something other than itself, to other differential traces, overruns its borders, all limits, everything set up in opposition to writing: speech, life, world, real, history, politics, economics

LOBL.content: [literary] title is not its own telos, not self-mirroring, writing prevents reflecting representation from folding back on itself
LOBL.linkedContent: [literary] title is not its own telos, not self-mirroring, writing prevents reflecting representation from folding back on itself

LOBL.content: writing is triumph, manic life-after-life insurance, indiscreet, exhibitionistic, even if  we read no “that’s me there” in it (this increase in discretion is more surplus-value of triumph), supplement of triumph, enough to make you sick
LOBL.linkedContent: writing is triumph, manic life-after-life insurance, indiscreet, exhibitionistic, even if we read no “that’s me there” in it (this increase in discretion is more surplus-value of triumph), supplement of triumph, enough to make you sick

LOBL.content: Derrida says this against Nietzsche: triumph over oneself is also a pursuit of power (Gewalt)
LOBL.linkedContent: Derrida says this against Nietzsche: triumph over oneself is also a pursuit of power (Gewalt)

LOBL.content: vitrifying structure of writing & desire > hymen (as syllepsis) and pane of glass; p. ~141 Blanchot: glass doesn’t use up what I enjoy, reads book behind pane of glass
LOBL.linkedContent: vitrifying structure of writing & desire > hymen (as syllepsis) and pane of glass; p. ~141 Blanchot: glass doesn’t use up what I enjoy, reads book behind pane of glass

LOBL.content: “and” as arrêt de mort, “and” of double bind, and I say “come,” “and immediately"-writing, annihilates time in ring of eternal return, yokes affirmation to itself in récit, the being-at-the-same-time of the other beyond time
LOBL.linkedContent: “and” as arrêt de mort, “and” of double bind, and I say “come,” “and immediately"-writing, annihilates time in ring of eternal return, yokes affirmation to itself in récit, the being-at-the-same-time of the other beyond time

LOBL.content: to speak of writing, triumph, as living on, is to denounce [Freud’s] manic fantasy (not w/out repeating it)
LOBL.linkedContent: to speak of writing, triumph, as living on, is to denounce [Freud’s] manic fantasy (not w/out repeating it)

MPM.content: for De Man, we all write, like Rousseau, w/in the “misleading” of the Versprechen, which nevertheless “conveys the promise of its own truth”
MPM.linkedContent: for De Man, we all write, like Rousseau, w/in the “misleading” of the Versprechen, which nevertheless “conveys the promise of its own truth”

MPM.content: every reading engaged in a promise w/in scene of a signature/writing
MPM.linkedContent: every reading engaged in a promise w/in scene of a signature/writing

MPM.content: apparent contradiction btwn act of reading and unreadability in the act > versprechen, promise at origin of history
MPM.linkedContent: apparent contradiction btwn act of reading and unreadability in the act > versprechen, promise at origin of history

MPM.content: every reading is writing (but we must demonstrate it, following structure of promise)
MPM.linkedContent: every reading is writing (but we must demonstrate it, following structure of promise)

MPM.content: you can only say and sign: yes, yes in memory of yes
MPM.linkedContent: you can only say and sign: yes, yes in memory of yes

MPM.content: writing, as an event of signature, a signature which can only promise itself in the sense that its destination is barred, impasse of aporia
MPM.linkedContent: writing, as an event of signature, a signature which can only promise itself in the sense that its destination is barred, impasse of aporia

MPM.content: we can only write what can be erased—otherwise no promise, no memory
MPM.linkedContent: we can only write what can be erased—otherwise no promise, no memory

MPM.content: undecidable is the condition of deconstruction (on and in [sur, dans?] this condition); in the sense of condition of possibility and, at the same time, condition as situation or destiny
MPM.linkedContent: undecidable is the condition of deconstruction (on and in [sur, dans?] this condition); in the sense of condition of possibility and, at the same time, condition as situation or destiny

MPM.content: this limit, this finitude, makes one write; deconstruction makes a path of writing through the aporia (impossible); deconstruction thinks only on the level of the impossible
MPM.linkedContent: this limit, this finitude, makes one write; deconstruction makes a path of writing through the aporia (impossible); deconstruction thinks only on the level of the impossible

MSUBJ.content: under the words (mots), hors sens, when you let attraction of words, motifs, motets [anthems] play under the meaning, you draw, sing, rather than speaking, you write the unwritable > this passage also convokes multiplicity of voices in a “motel,” rhythm, vibration
MSUBJ.linkedContent: under the words (mots), hors sens, when you let attraction of words, motifs, motets [anthems] play under the meaning, you draw, sing, rather than speaking, you write the unwritable > this passage also convokes multiplicity of voices in a “motel,” rhythm, vibration

EM.content: Heidegger: written form exerts wholesome pressure, present world crisis needs less philosophy, more thinking, less literature, we must liberate Dichtung from literature
EM.linkedContent: Heidegger: written form exerts wholesome pressure, present world crisis needs less philosophy, more thinking, less literature, we must liberate Dichtung from literature

SEC.content: Derrida will differentiate writing from a concept of communication which would treat the nonsemantic (gestures, tremors, shocks) as proper or primitive meaning
SEC.linkedContent: Derrida will differentiate writing from a concept of communication which would treat the nonsemantic (gestures, tremors, shocks) as proper or primitive meaning

SEC.content: writing in accepted sense (not innocent, primitive, or natural) > writing a means of communication which extends field of oral/gestural communication; Derrida asks if this presupposes a homogenous space of communication? [writing extends limits of speech further]
SEC.linkedContent: writing in accepted sense (not innocent, primitive, or natural) > writing a means of communication which extends field of oral/gestural communication; Derrida asks if this presupposes a homogenous space of communication? [writing extends limits of speech further]

SEC.content: Derrida wants to examine conditions of emergence & occultation of generic, classical interpretation of writing
SEC.linkedContent: Derrida wants to examine conditions of emergence & occultation of generic, classical interpretation of writing

SEC.content: Condillac an example w/out counterexample of properly philosophical interpretation of writing
SEC.linkedContent: Condillac an example w/out counterexample of properly philosophical interpretation of writing

SEC.content: we write to absent persons, general assumption of writing is that it is a vehicle that has no effect on the meaning it vehiculates (writing as picture)
SEC.linkedContent: we write to absent persons, general assumption of writing is that it is a vehicle that has no effect on the meaning it vehiculates (writing as picture)

SEC.content: history of writing conform to law of mechanical economy: gain most space & time by means of most convenient abbreviation
SEC.linkedContent: history of writing conform to law of mechanical economy: gain most space & time by means of most convenient abbreviation

SEC.content: though representation supplements presence, the general assumption [Condillac] is that writing repairs > a continuous, homogenous modification of presence in representation
SEC.linkedContent: though representation supplements presence, the general assumption [Condillac] is that writing repairs > a continuous, homogenous modification of presence in representation

SEC.content: idea/sign relation preserved through all forms of writing [in Condillac] (hieroglyph, ideograph, phonetic): economic, mechanical, homogenous reduction, community of analogical participation
SEC.linkedContent: idea/sign relation preserved through all forms of writing [in Condillac] (hieroglyph, ideograph, phonetic): economic, mechanical, homogenous reduction, community of analogical participation

SEC.content: writing functions in absence of addressee, beyond his life itself
SEC.linkedContent: writing functions in absence of addressee, beyond his life itself

SEC.content: for Condillac, for French “ideologues,” writing as species w/in genus of communication
SEC.linkedContent: for Condillac, for French “ideologues,” writing as species w/in genus of communication

SEC.content: if all signs suppose absence, writing would no longer be a species of communication, and all other theories would be uncritical, ensuring authority and force of a certain historical discourse
SEC.linkedContent: if all signs suppose absence, writing would no longer be a species of communication, and all other theories would be uncritical, ensuring authority and force of a certain historical discourse

SEC.content: absence of addressee, différance, must be brought to an absolute degree (to make writing possible), not reduced to a presence that is distant [an absence that carries all the way to death]
SEC.linkedContent: absence of addressee, différance, must be brought to an absolute degree (to make writing possible), not reduced to a presence that is distant [an absence that carries all the way to death]

SEC.content: “supposing that writing exists”
SEC.linkedContent: “supposing that writing exists”

SEC.content: [writing must be structurally legible, iterable vs. Lacan’s the letter always arrives]
SEC.linkedContent: [writing must be structurally legible, iterable vs. Lacan’s the letter always arrives]

SEC.content: no code of writing is structurally secret, can always be iterable for a 3<sup><small>rd</small></sup> party
SEC.linkedContent: no code of writing is structurally secret, can always be iterable for a 3rd party

SEC.content: absence—death of addressee (inscribed in mark) > value or effect of transcendentality linked to possibility of writing, to this “death”
SEC.linkedContent: absence—death of addressee (inscribed in mark) > value or effect of transcendentality linked to possibility of writing, to this “death”

SEC.content: to write is to produce a mark that is a kind of machine, legible in scribe’s absence (this drifting of absolute responsibility, this orphaned writing > what Plato condemns in Phaedrus)
SEC.linkedContent: to write is to produce a mark that is a kind of machine, legible in scribe’s absence (this drifting of absolute responsibility, this orphaned writing > what Plato condemns in Phaedrus)

SEC.content: take classical notion of writing, make it generalizable to all order of signs, and extend it even to experience of Being
SEC.linkedContent: take classical notion of writing, make it generalizable to all order of signs, and extend it even to experience of Being

SEC.content: a written sign can break with its context (set of presences which organize moment of inscription), still be legible, can always be lifted from interlocking chain, grafted into other chains ——no context, no code can enclose it > code: possibility/impossibility of writing, of its essential iterability (repetition/alterity)
SEC.linkedContent: a written sign can break with its context (set of presences which organize moment of inscription), still be legible, can always be lifted from interlocking chain, grafted into other chains ——no context, no code can enclose it > code: possibility/impossibility of writing, of its essential iterability (repetition/alterity)

SEC.content: isn’t iterability of writing also in speech and in all experience? > never permits unity of self-identity
SEC.linkedContent: isn’t iterability of writing also in speech and in all experience? > never permits unity of self-identity

SEC.content: writing has always been treated as a parasite
SEC.linkedContent: writing has always been treated as a parasite

SEC.content: differance, “the irreducible absence of intention or assistance [due to iteration] from the performative statement, from the most ‘event-like’ statement possible” authorizes Derrida to posit general graphematic structure of every “communication”
SEC.linkedContent: differance, “the irreducible absence of intention or assistance [due to iteration] from the performative statement, from the most ‘event-like’ statement possible” authorizes Derrida to posit general graphematic structure of every “communication”

VM.content: inhabit metaphor’s ruins, s’habiller des lambeaux de la tradition et des haillons du diable: by using tradition’s words, one can use [them] up (user), les frotter comme une vieille pièce de monnaie fruste et dévaluée, on peut dire que la vraie extériorité est la non-extérioritée sans être l’intériorité, on peut écrire par ratures et ratures de ratures: crossing out writes, still writes in space
VM.linkedContent: inhabit metaphor’s ruins, s’habiller des lambeaux de la tradition et des haillons du diable: by using tradition’s words, one can use [them] up (user), les frotter comme une vieille pièce de monnaie fruste et dévaluée, on peut dire que la vraie extériorité est la non-extérioritée sans être l’intériorité, on peut écrire par ratures et ratures de ratures: crossing out writes, still writes in space

VM.content: “syntax of the Site whose archaic description is not legible on the metal of language cannot be erased: it is this metal itself, its too somber solidity and its too shining brilliance”
VM.linkedContent: “syntax of the Site whose archaic description is not legible on the metal of language cannot be erased: it is this metal itself, its too somber solidity and its too shining brilliance”

VM.content: langage, fils de la terre et du soleil: écriture > one could never come across a language w/out rupture of space, no aerial or aquatic language, in which alterity would be more lost than ever > structure of inside-outside/day-night has no meaning in pure space [proscribed words], inhabits conceptuality itself
VM.linkedContent: langage, fils de la terre et du soleil: écriture > one could never come across a language w/out rupture of space, no aerial or aquatic language, in which alterity would be more lost than ever > structure of inside-outside/day-night has no meaning in pure space [proscribed words], inhabits conceptuality itself

PP.content: cutting trace (la trace coupante): the decision of each reading, risk getting fingers caught, only chance, must not only look but touch the text
PP.linkedContent: cutting trace (la trace coupante): the decision of each reading, risk getting fingers caught, only chance, must not only look but touch the text

PP.content: reading is writing, a single gesture, but doubled, le est qui accouple la lecture à l’écriture doit en découdre
PP.linkedContent: reading is writing, a single gesture, but doubled, le est qui accouple la lecture à l’écriture doit en découdre

PP.content: Plato: writing always signifies (sēmainei) the same, can only repeat (itself), it is a game (paidia)
PP.linkedContent: Plato: writing always signifies (sēmainei) the same, can only repeat (itself), it is a game (paidia)

PP.content: problem of writing linked to problem of “knowing by heart” [speech] > need pharmakon, biblia, if one has not learned speech by heart
PP.linkedContent: problem of writing linked to problem of “knowing by heart” [speech] > need pharmakon, biblia, if one has not learned speech by heart

PP.content: writing is open to empiricism & chance, is a drug, governed by ways of magic
PP.linkedContent: writing is open to empiricism & chance, is a drug, governed by ways of magic

PP.content: Plato: questions of impropriety and propriety in writing
PP.linkedContent: Plato: questions of impropriety and propriety in writing

PP.content: writing as a question of morality, sophistry
PP.linkedContent: writing as a question of morality, sophistry

PP.content: writing linked to myth, both contra knowledge (sought w/in oneself)
PP.linkedContent: writing linked to myth, both contra knowledge (sought w/in oneself)

PP.content: writing as repeating w/out knowing (through a myth [?])
PP.linkedContent: writing as repeating w/out knowing (through a myth [?])

PP.content: king, father, does not need to write
PP.linkedContent: king, father, does not need to write

PP.content: god of writing must be god of death: breathless sign replaces living word
PP.linkedContent: god of writing must be god of death: breathless sign replaces living word

PP.content: excess, displacement of series, n’est pas une simple sortie hors de la série (ce geste tombe sous une catégorie de la série), a folding back (repli), a re-mark, cannot name it with a single concept w/out being off the mark (sans le manquer): it is a real and necessary challenge that writes itself, and we must begin by reading it
PP.linkedContent: excess, displacement of series, n’est pas une simple sortie hors de la série (ce geste tombe sous une catégorie de la série), a folding back (repli), a re-mark, cannot name it with a single concept w/out being off the mark (sans le manquer): it is a real and necessary challenge that writes itself, and we must begin by reading it

PP.content: writing is not a good tekhnē, not a productive art, not secure (saphes kai bebaion), like alētheia (nonsensible visibility, intelligible invisibility)
PP.linkedContent: writing is not a good tekhnē, not a productive art, not secure (saphes kai bebaion), like alētheia (nonsensible visibility, intelligible invisibility)

PP.content: writing can only repeat its own hollowness, subject already knows signifieds, gives them to writing on consignment
PP.linkedContent: writing can only repeat its own hollowness, subject already knows signifieds, gives them to writing on consignment

PP.content: writing stripped of its path-breaking force, pure repetition, dead repetition, tautological, hollow, repetition of death > writing is not living repetition of the living
PP.linkedContent: writing stripped of its path-breaking force, pure repetition, dead repetition, tautological, hollow, repetition of death > writing is not living repetition of the living

PP.content: writing paints living word, painting (zōgraphia, zōgraphēma sometimes shortened to gramma), both interrogated by living word > masks, figurines, simulacra denature what they claim to imitate, writing & painting should aim at resembling/faithfulness to their model
PP.linkedContent: writing paints living word, painting (zōgraphia, zōgraphēma sometimes shortened to gramma), both interrogated by living word > masks, figurines, simulacra denature what they claim to imitate, writing & painting should aim at resembling/faithfulness to their model

PP.content: from Phaedrus, writing is like painting, when you question it, responds w/ majestic silence > can’t answer for itself
PP.linkedContent: from Phaedrus, writing is like painting, when you question it, responds w/ majestic silence > can’t answer for itself

PP.content: writing: death, mask, festival, cosmetic, it others, destroys sameness
PP.linkedContent: writing: death, mask, festival, cosmetic, it others, destroys sameness

PP.content: democracy is like writing, Plato’s trial against democracy similar to that against pharmakon: excess, anarchy, orgy, flea market, fair, bazaar (pantopōlion); errant democratic man has no substance, not perverse in regular way, like signifier freed from logos
PP.linkedContent: democracy is like writing, Plato’s trial against democracy similar to that against pharmakon: excess, anarchy, orgy, flea market, fair, bazaar (pantopōlion); errant democratic man has no substance, not perverse in regular way, like signifier freed from logos

PP.content: soul-inscription, inscription of truth in soul, uses a metaphor [Plato admits it] that philosophy will never be able to do w/out, must borrow from simulacrum; metaphoricity is logic of contamination, contamination of logic
PP.linkedContent: soul-inscription, inscription of truth in soul, uses a metaphor [Plato admits it] that philosophy will never be able to do w/out, must borrow from simulacrum; metaphoricity is logic of contamination, contamination of logic

PP.content: good writing can only be described through metaphor of the bad
PP.linkedContent: good writing can only be described through metaphor of the bad

PP.content: Plato prefers one writing over the other, a good writing over bad, a fertile trace (endgenders w/in) over a sterile one (une semence dépensée au-dehors en pure perte, risk of dissemination)
PP.linkedContent: Plato prefers one writing over the other, a good writing over bad, a fertile trace (endgenders w/in) over a sterile one (une semence dépensée au-dehors en pure perte, risk of dissemination)

PP.content: good-writing is serious (spoudē), pharmakon, ephemeral produce is a game (paidia)
PP.linkedContent: good-writing is serious (spoudē), pharmakon, ephemeral produce is a game (paidia)

PP.content: seed must submit to logos, do violence to itself, since sperm is opposed to law of logos > when Plato turns live speech into psychic graphē he does so w/ a problematic of truth: l’écriture en tè psuchè n’est pas une écriture de frayage, mais seulement d’enseignement, de transmission, écriture d’aletheia
PP.linkedContent: seed must submit to logos, do violence to itself, since sperm is opposed to law of logos > when Plato turns live speech into psychic graphē he does so w/ a problematic of truth: l’écriture en tè psuchè n’est pas une écriture de frayage, mais seulement d’enseignement, de transmission, écriture d’aletheia

PP.content: no as such where writing or play are concerned, they cannot be classically affirmed (since they have no essence) w/out being negated, le jeu et la graphie vont sans cesse disparaissant
PP.linkedContent: no as such where writing or play are concerned, they cannot be classically affirmed (since they have no essence) w/out being negated, le jeu et la graphie vont sans cesse disparaissant

PP.content: the 3 eras of “Platonism” (Plato, Saussure, and Rousseau), which put writing out of question while borrowing from it all its demonstrative/theoretical resources, must come to terms w/: 1) generalized sort of writing 2) a “contradiction”: written proposal of logocentrism 3) construction of “literary” work
PP.linkedContent: the 3 eras of “Platonism” (Plato, Saussure, and Rousseau), which put writing out of question while borrowing from it all its demonstrative/theoretical resources, must come to terms w/: 1) generalized sort of writing 2) a “contradiction”: written proposal of logocentrism 3) construction of “literary” work

PP.content: writing is parricidal
PP.linkedContent: writing is parricidal

PP.content: disappearance, retrait of father’s face (good-sun-capital) is movement of differance, which opens to writing, which writing opens for itself, threatens hierarchical interiority of pharmacy
PP.linkedContent: disappearance, retrait of father’s face (good-sun-capital) is movement of differance, which opens to writing, which writing opens for itself, threatens hierarchical interiority of pharmacy

PP.content: if disappearance of good-father-capital-sun is precondition of discourse, writing (is) epekeina tēs ousias
PP.linkedContent: if disappearance of good-father-capital-sun is precondition of discourse, writing (is) epekeina tēs ousias

PAS.content: “écriture comme trace d’un mouvement sans origin, sans fin, sans langage, sans…”
PAS.linkedContent: “écriture comme trace d’un mouvement sans origin, sans fin, sans langage, sans…”

PAS.content: what does sauf mean? save them from an outside not even proper to them? sauf: secret (dérobé), powerful word, language fascinates starting form it > like sans, pas: crumbles, precludes the set from understanding itself: “rien sauf le dehors” > sauvetage project part of writing project
PAS.linkedContent: what does sauf mean? save them from an outside not even proper to them? sauf: secret (dérobé), powerful word, language fascinates starting form it > like sans, pas: crumbles, precludes the set from understanding itself: “rien sauf le dehors” > sauvetage project part of writing project

PAS.content: assimilating interiority of mastery can also be terrible thus compulsion toward outside could be defense > sauf le dehors, tout sauf le dehors
PAS.linkedContent: assimilating interiority of mastery can also be terrible thus compulsion toward outside could be defense > sauf le dehors, tout sauf le dehors

PAS.content: Blanchot: “friendship for the demand to write which excludes all friendship”
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: “friendship for the demand to write which excludes all friendship”

VP.content: for Husserl, writing, as usual, is an indication which needs to be reawakened, reawaken the word in the body of the letter, a letter that threatens emptiness
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, writing, as usual, is an indication which needs to be reawakened, reawaken the word in the body of the letter, a letter that threatens emptiness

VP.content: Husserl tormented by possibility that writing inhabits inside of speech, itself at work in intimacy of thought
VP.linkedContent: Husserl tormented by possibility that writing inhabits inside of speech, itself at work in intimacy of thought

VP.content: that pure grammar can work w/out object, w/out intuition, leads Derrida to the privilege of writing as the common name for all signification, must work after death
VP.linkedContent: that pure grammar can work w/out object, w/out intuition, leads Derrida to the privilege of writing as the common name for all signification, must work after death

VP.content: writing inaugurates and completes idealization, neither real nor ideal, allows possibility to think idealization, death, repetition and signification in the same opennesses
VP.linkedContent: writing inaugurates and completes idealization, neither real nor ideal, allows possibility to think idealization, death, repetition and signification in the same opennesses

S.content: wouldn’t Jews, Moslem, Christians respond to Heidegger’s retrait, flame and fire-writing in promise? [messianic echoes]
S.linkedContent: wouldn’t Jews, Moslem, Christians respond to Heidegger’s retrait, flame and fire-writing in promise? [messianic echoes]

FSW.content: for Freud, metaphor of writing appropriates problems of psychic apparatus in structure & psychic text in fabric
FSW.linkedContent: for Freud, metaphor of writing appropriates problems of psychic apparatus in structure & psychic text in fabric

FSW.content: agreeing w/ Saussure that signifier/signified two sides of same paper, originary writing must still produce space & materiality of sheet itself
FSW.linkedContent: agreeing w/ Saussure that signifier/signified two sides of same paper, originary writing must still produce space & materiality of sheet itself

FSW.content: to speak of writing, to betray Freud more than ever
FSW.linkedContent: to speak of writing, to betray Freud more than ever

FSW.content: labor of writing erases transcendental distinction btwn origin of world and Being-in-the-world, erases it while producing it
FSW.linkedContent: labor of writing erases transcendental distinction btwn origin of world and Being-in-the-world, erases it while producing it

FSW.content: fundamental property of writing is spacing: diastem (interval, interruption) & time becoming space, unfolding (not linear time) [see Nancy’s Corpus on diastole]
FSW.linkedContent: fundamental property of writing is spacing: diastem (interval, interruption) & time becoming space, unfolding (not linear time) [see Nancy’s Corpus on diastole]

FSW.content: writing as trace survives scratch’s present, punctuality, stigmē
writing unthinkable w/out repression > Freud uses metaphor of censorship, writing as vigilance [neither permanent contact] & failure [nor permanent break] of censorship
FSW.linkedContent: writing unthinkable w/out repression > Freud uses metaphor of censorship, writing as vigilance [neither permanent contact] & failure [nor permanent break] of censorship

FSW.content: if there were only perception, pure permeability of breaching, there would be no breaches (frayages), no legible writing, but pure perception does not exist: nous ne sommes écrits qu’en écrivants > subject of writing does not exist as sovereign solitude of author
FSW.linkedContent: if there were only perception, pure permeability of breaching, there would be no breaches (frayages), no legible writing, but pure perception does not exist: nous ne sommes écrits qu’en écrivants > subject of writing does not exist as sovereign solitude of author

FSW.content: Freud augured a beyond and beneath of “Platonic” closure > by opening to theme of writing, writing as technē, as relation btwn life & death, btwn psychical and nonpsychical
FSW.linkedContent: Freud augured a beyond and beneath of “Platonic” closure > by opening to theme of writing, writing as technē, as relation btwn life & death, btwn psychical and nonpsychical

FSW.content: this opening never made explicit, but became urgent in relation to the [failure] of rhetorical device of metaphor [re: Mystic Pad]
FSW.linkedContent: this opening never made explicit, but became urgent in relation to the [failure] of rhetorical device of metaphor [re: Mystic Pad]

FSW.content: writing is stage of history & play of world
FSW.linkedContent: writing is stage of history & play of world

TC.content: Artaud wants to destroy all writing after reading it once; Artaud vs. Plato > both against writing: Artaud because it’s the erasure of body, Plato because it is body
TC.linkedContent: Artaud wants to destroy all writing after reading it once; Artaud vs. Plato > both against writing: Artaud because it’s the erasure of body, Plato because it is body

PPHS.content: classical take on writing as “practical exterior activity,” as that which “comes to the aid” condemns all mnemotechniques, all langue machines, all supplementary repetitions > life of spirit is thusly forced to emerge from its interior
PPHS.linkedContent: classical take on writing as “practical exterior activity,” as that which “comes to the aid” condemns all mnemotechniques, all langue machines, all supplementary repetitions > life of spirit is thusly forced to emerge from its interior

PPHS.content: [TN. Derrida often compares philosophical treatment of writing to Freud’s “kettle logic”]
PPHS.linkedContent: [TN. Derrida often compares philosophical treatment of writing to Freud’s “kettle logic”]

SH.content: Sichelschrift > cuts in coming around > another turning (not rounding), another trope, inscribes letters in cutting all around > circumcises words in silence?
SH.linkedContent: Sichelschrift > cuts in coming around > another turning (not rounding), another trope, inscribes letters in cutting all around > circumcises words in silence?

F.content: writing not essentially verbal or phonetic, body signs even before any “proper” name > no difference btwn verbal behavior of patient & paramecium faced w/ obstacle
F.linkedContent: writing not essentially verbal or phonetic, body signs even before any “proper” name > no difference btwn verbal behavior of patient & paramecium faced w/ obstacle

FWT.content: writing, trace, gramma or grapheme exceed opposition: human/nonhuman > extend field of living, or rather life/death relation
FWT.linkedContent: writing, trace, gramma or grapheme exceed opposition: human/nonhuman > extend field of living, or rather life/death relation

DS.content: when writing is regarded as mimesis, the most it can be valued is equal to truth it’s imitating
DS.linkedContent: when writing is regarded as mimesis, the most it can be valued is equal to truth it’s imitating

DS.content: only metaphors of painting and writing are linked to psyche > in “reality,” literally, acc. Plato, writing & painting deal in copies, copies of copies, incapable of intuition of thing itself
DS.linkedContent: only metaphors of painting and writing are linked to psyche > in “reality,” literally, acc. Plato, writing & painting deal in copies, copies of copies, incapable of intuition of thing itself

DS.content: space of writing: “event”—hymen, crime, suicide, spasm (laughter/pleasure): everything describes structure of text & effectuates its possibility > a lustre which is nothing beyond its own fragmented light
DS.linkedContent: space of writing: “event”—hymen, crime, suicide, spasm (laughter/pleasure): everything describes structure of text & effectuates its possibility > a lustre which is nothing beyond its own fragmented light

DS.content: mime mimes a kind of writing, is himself written in a kind of writing, nothing of what is can lie beyond medium/speculum reading-writing > there is 1) writing w/out book, marking tip (la pointe du trait) proceeds w/out past upon virgin sheet 2) infinite number of booklets in other booklets > Mallarmé reads, writes while reading, while reading text written by Mime, who himself reads in order to write
DS.linkedContent: mime mimes a kind of writing, is himself written in a kind of writing, nothing of what is can lie beyond medium/speculum reading-writing > there is 1) writing w/out book, marking tip (la pointe du trait) proceeds w/out past upon virgin sheet 2) infinite number of booklets in other booklets > Mallarmé reads, writes while reading, while reading text written by Mime, who himself reads in order to write

DS.content: surprise in writing, supplement, baffling economy of seduction: entre… un silence
DS.linkedContent: surprise in writing, supplement, baffling economy of seduction: entre… un silence

DS.content: fold, multi-pli-cations (folders, foldouts, etc.)—ploys (all the figures) & the re-mark of the fold-upon-itself of writing (again)
DS.linkedContent: fold, multi-pli-cations (folders, foldouts, etc.)—ploys (all the figures) & the re-mark of the fold-upon-itself of writing (again)

POS.content: no end of the book, no beginning of writing, writing puts archie in question
POS.linkedContent: no end of the book, no beginning of writing, writing puts archie in question

POS.content: Derrida never identified writing w/ myth, what interested him was how philosophy excluded writing to keep myth exterior to scientific rationality > deconstruction attempts to break up opposition btwn logos and mythos
POS.linkedContent: Derrida never identified writing w/ myth, what interested him was how philosophy excluded writing to keep myth exterior to scientific rationality > deconstruction attempts to break up opposition btwn logos and mythos

POS.content: how the “fall,” abasement (of writing) only functions via thought of origin
POS.linkedContent: how the “fall,” abasement (of writing) only functions via thought of origin

POS.content: writing structurally carries w/in itself (counts-discounts) its own erasure, while marking what remains of this erasure
POS.linkedContent: writing structurally carries w/in itself (counts-discounts) its own erasure, while marking what remains of this erasure

POS.content: the strategy of paleonomy, of using old name, refers to play of stratagem not hierarchical organization of means & ends: 1) extract predicative trait held in reserve 2) extend, graft, extracted trait, as a lever of intervention, transforming previous organization [writing]
POS.linkedContent: the strategy of paleonomy, of using old name, refers to play of stratagem not hierarchical organization of means & ends: 1) extract predicative trait held in reserve 2) extend, graft, extracted trait, as a lever of intervention, transforming previous organization [writing]

POS.content: “I read while writing: slowly, taking pleasure in long prefaces to each term”
POS.linkedContent: “I read while writing: slowly, taking pleasure in long prefaces to each term”

OS.content: differance as a difference older than Being itself, a still more unthought difference than difference of Being/beings > leads to a writing that exceeds all dialectics, w/out history, cause, absence, presence, archia, telos
OS.linkedContent: differance as a difference older than Being itself, a still more unthought difference than difference of Being/beings > leads to a writing that exceeds all dialectics, w/out history, cause, absence, presence, archia, telos

ROP.content: deconstruction announces status w/out status of nonfinite # of names/quasi-concepts: the thinking of writing called for this, but it’s better thematized and formalized in theory of double bind, stricture of double band, and especially non-ontological remaining
ROP.linkedContent: deconstruction announces status w/out status of nonfinite # of names/quasi-concepts: the thinking of writing called for this, but it’s better thematized and formalized in theory of double bind, stricture of double band, and especially non-ontological remaining

ATIA.content: what is terrible (deinon) about writing (painting), for Socrates, is its majestic silence, it does not respond [animals too?]
ATIA.linkedContent: what is terrible (deinon) about writing (painting), for Socrates, is its majestic silence, it does not respond [animals too?]

GSP.content: in writing, sign can always “empty” itself, may never be reactivated, risks remaining forever closed & mute
GSP.linkedContent: in writing, sign can always “empty” itself, may never be reactivated, risks remaining forever closed & mute

FS.content: for Blanchot, pure absence, the excess of everything—possibility of writing (absence of everything in which presence is announced) > makes one work
FS.linkedContent: for Blanchot, pure absence, the excess of everything—possibility of writing (absence of everything in which presence is announced) > makes one work

FS.content: doesn’t pure speech require inscription, isn’t it a privileged representation of inscription? just like Leibniz’s essence requires existence (pushes out toward world), power <small>></small> act?
FS.linkedContent: doesn’t pure speech require inscription, isn’t it a privileged representation of inscription? just like Leibniz’s essence requires existence (pushes out toward world), power > act?

FS.content: God of Leibniz does not know the anguish of choice, only one book distributed through all books, God’s Will always chooses the “best”
FS.linkedContent: God of Leibniz does not know the anguish of choice, only one book distributed through all books, God’s Will always chooses the “best”

FS.content: writing, not a determined pathos, an empirical state of writer, but responsibility of angustia: [Derrida is privileging a power of equivocality over creativity of classical God, anguish connoting a narrowing, a loss of breath, a restriction, constraint, and thus the anguish of choice]
FS.linkedContent: writing, not a determined pathos, an empirical state of writer, but responsibility of angustia: [Derrida is privileging a power of equivocality over creativity of classical God, anguish connoting a narrowing, a loss of breath, a restriction, constraint, and thus the anguish of choice]

FS.content: to write: 1) not only to conceive Leibnizian book as an impossible possibility (as Mallarmé names the limit) 2) ce n'est pas seulement savoir que le Livre n'existe pas et qu'à jamais il y a des livres où (se) brise, avant même d'avoir été un, le sens d'un monde impensé par un sujet absolu [the English translation of this sentence fails to capture the sense of the books themselves shattering] 3) nor is it to have lost the certainty of pages binding themselves into a “book of reason” 4) not only to know that the non-written can’t be relegated to having no basis by the obliging negativity of some dialectic 5) not only to know that through writing the best may not transpire 6) it is the impossibility of making meaning precede writing: it is to lower meaning while elevating inscription
FS.linkedContent: to write: 1) not only to conceive Leibnizian book as an impossible possibility (as Mallarmé names the limit) 2) ce n'est pas seulement savoir que le Livre n'existe pas et qu'à jamais il y a des livres où (se) brise, avant même d'avoir été un, le sens d'un monde impensé par un sujet absolu [the English translation of this sentence fails to capture the sense of the books themselves shattering] 3) nor is it to have lost the certainty of pages binding themselves into a “book of reason” 4) not only to know that the non-written can’t be relegated to having no basis by the obliging negativity of some dialectic 5) not only to know that through writing the best may not transpire 6) it is the impossibility of making meaning precede writing: it is to lower meaning while elevating inscription

FS.content: absence & haunting of divine sign (Jewish God) [cf. GOD], anguish of Hebraic ruah (pneuma), regulates modern books/criticism/aesthetics
FS.linkedContent: absence & haunting of divine sign (Jewish God) [cf. GOD], anguish of Hebraic ruah (pneuma), regulates modern books/criticism/aesthetics

FS.content: writing does not await prescription from some topos ouranios, or divine understanding it’s because writing is inaugural that it is dangerous and anguishing, doesn’t know where it’s going, essential precipitation toward meaning that it constitutes—is its future [ex-stasis?]
FS.linkedContent: writing does not await prescription from some topos ouranios, or divine understanding it’s because writing is inaugural that it is dangerous and anguishing, doesn’t know where it’s going, essential precipitation toward meaning that it constitutes—is its future [ex-stasis?]

FS.content: meaning must await being said/written in order to inhabit itself
FS.linkedContent: meaning must await being said/written in order to inhabit itself

FS.content: writing is only capricious through cowardice
John Chrysostom: writing is second best course
FS.linkedContent: John Chrysostom: writing is second best course

FS.content: God imprints secondarity on every navigation of the human: 1) passage of deferred reciprocity btwn reading & writing? 2) absolute witness who’s already read what you will write: third party as transparency of meaning? [circular logos]
FS.linkedContent: God imprints secondarity on every navigation of the human: 1) passage of deferred reciprocity btwn reading & writing? 2) absolute witness who’s already read what you will write: third party as transparency of meaning? [circular logos]

FS.content: through Rousset, a form of writing where true literary language, poetry, is access to free speech, pure historicity, beyond affectivity (finitude & empiricism), not a voluntarism, will to write actives the will itself, freedom, to write would be to forget difference, to forget writing
FS.linkedContent: through Rousset, a form of writing where true literary language, poetry, is access to free speech, pure historicity, beyond affectivity (finitude & empiricism), not a voluntarism, will to write actives the will itself, freedom, to write would be to forget difference, to forget writing

FS.content: attempt-to-write, moment of overflow (can’t be understand via voluntarism): when play of meaning overflows signification, which is always enveloped by limits of nature, life, soul
FS.linkedContent: attempt-to-write, moment of overflow (can’t be understand via voluntarism): when play of meaning overflows signification, which is always enveloped by limits of nature, life, soul

FS.content: Nietzsche against Flaubert for believing in the work over the man (sedentary life), we would have to choose btwn writing and dance: dance of the pen? but we must hunch to write
FS.linkedContent: Nietzsche against Flaubert for believing in the work over the man (sedentary life), we would have to choose btwn writing and dance: dance of the pen? but we must hunch to write

FS.content: writing: “excavation (creusement) w/in the other toward the other in which the same seeks its (sa) vein and the true gold of its phenomenon”
FS.linkedContent: writing: “excavation (creusement) w/in the other toward the other in which the same seeks its (sa) vein and the true gold of its phenomenon”

FS.content: l'écriture est l'issue comme descente hors de soi en soi du sens: métaphore-pour-autrui-en-vuc-d'autrui-ici-bas, métaphore comme possibilité d'autrui ici-bas, métaphore comme métaphysique où l'être doit se cacher si l'on veut que l'autre apparaisse
FS.linkedContent: l'écriture est l'issue comme descente hors de soi en soi du sens: métaphore-pour-autrui-en-vuc-d'autrui-ici-bas, métaphore comme possibilité d'autrui ici-bas, métaphore comme métaphysique où l'être doit se cacher si l'on veut que l'autre apparaisse

FS.content: writing, moment of depth as decay > original valley of the other w/in Being; incidence & insistence of inscription
FS.linkedContent: writing, moment of depth as decay > original valley of the other w/in Being; incidence & insistence of inscription

DIF.content: Aufhebung constrained into writing itself otherwise, or simply into writing itself, or taking into account its consumption of writing (sa consommation d’écriture) [re: general/restricted economy]
DIF.linkedContent: Aufhebung constrained into writing itself otherwise, or simply into writing itself, or taking into account its consumption of writing (sa consommation d’écriture) [re: general/restricted economy]

O.content: writing situates every signified as a differential trace
re: writing, Hegel does not think exteriority, repetitive autonomy of remainder > writing becomes pro-gramme, pre-scription, pre-text, the simple empirical husk (déchet) of concept
O.linkedContent: re: writing, Hegel does not think exteriority, repetitive autonomy of remainder > writing becomes pro-gramme, pre-scription, pre-text, the simple empirical husk (déchet) of concept

O.content: for Derrida, this husk is coextensive w/ whole life of discourse
O.linkedContent: for Derrida, this husk is coextensive w/ whole life of discourse

WAP.content: double metaphoric of inscription (Plato, Cousin): bad writing (occults, perverts) is cryptic, artificial, secondary, voiceless > must be replaced by good writing
WAP.linkedContent: double metaphoric of inscription (Plato, Cousin): bad writing (occults, perverts) is cryptic, artificial, secondary, voiceless > must be replaced by good writing

CHM.content: vouloir-dire-l’hyperbole not antagonistic to silence but its condition, not voluntarism but a 1st passion, il garde en lui la trace d’une violence, more written than said: differance of absolute excess (economy btwn that which exceeds and exceeded totality)
CHM.linkedContent: vouloir-dire-l’hyperbole not antagonistic to silence but its condition, not voluntarism but a 1st passion, il garde en lui la trace d’une violence, more written than said: differance of absolute excess (economy btwn that which exceeds and exceeded totality)

RGE.content: absurd for transgression of Book by writing to be legible only in a determined sense
RGE.linkedContent: absurd for transgression of Book by writing to be legible only in a determined sense

REST.content: fort/da not a relation of opposition, each notion offers an eyelet to be traversed by the other, to the figure or the pointure of the other (Heidegger’s playing w/ the bobbin)
REST.linkedContent: fort/da not a relation of opposition, each notion offers an eyelet to be traversed by the other, to the figure or the pointure of the other (Heidegger’s playing w/ the bobbin)

REST.content: fort: da, double eyelet [i.e. colon instead of slash]: how it must be “reknotted/taken up (renouer)” again in writing
REST.linkedContent: fort: da, double eyelet [i.e. colon instead of slash]: how it must be “reknotted/taken up (renouer)” again in writing

DST.content: obsessionality, re: writing, no longer clinical category
DST.linkedContent: obsessionality, re: writing, no longer clinical category

DST.content: Bataille: what forces me to write is the fear of going mad
DST.linkedContent: Bataille: what forces me to write is the fear of going mad

TR.content: not only accusation & judgment in confession, there’s the executioner (carrying out of the sentence): sentence endured in pleasure of writing, ambiguous enjoyment at heart of terrible, severe jubilation of inscription: one steps up to cashier right away to collect interest on a capital that will assume value only “sooner or later,” after my death, in my absence
TR.linkedContent: not only accusation & judgment in confession, there’s the executioner (carrying out of the sentence): sentence endured in pleasure of writing, ambiguous enjoyment at heart of terrible, severe jubilation of inscription: one steps up to cashier right away to collect interest on a capital that will assume value only “sooner or later,” after my death, in my absence

EJQB.content: Judaism and the birth/passion of writing (origin of historicity)
EJQB.linkedContent: Judaism and the birth/passion of writing (origin of historicity)

EJQB.content: the exchange btwn Jew & writing, exchange w/out prerogative, where original appeal is a convocation (Jabès’ persistent affirmation)
EJQB.linkedContent: the exchange btwn Jew & writing, exchange w/out prerogative, where original appeal is a convocation (Jabès’ persistent affirmation)

EJQB.content: writing (originally) as secondary, hermetic: displaced on broken line btwn lost & poisoned speech [re: God’s silence, repentance, broken Tables]
EJQB.linkedContent: writing (originally) as secondary, hermetic: displaced on broken line btwn lost & poisoned speech [re: God’s silence, repentance, broken Tables]

EJQB.content: separation of life & thought: infinite anchoritism (writing as moment of Desert, Judaic experience as reflection)
EJQB.linkedContent: separation of life & thought: infinite anchoritism (writing as moment of Desert, Judaic experience as reflection)

EJQB.content: to be a poet is to know how to have speech, let it speak alone, which it can do only in its written form
EJQB.linkedContent: to be a poet is to know how to have speech, let it speak alone, which it can do only in its written form

EJQB.content: to leave writing: be there only to provide its passageway (laisser le passage)
EJQB.linkedContent: to leave writing: be there only to provide its passageway (laisser le passage)

EJQB.content: only that which is written gives me existence by naming me (things come into existence & lose existence by being named) > sacrifice of existence to the word (Hegel), but also consecration of existence by word: one must write, not simply be written, in order to have a name
EJQB.linkedContent: only that which is written gives me existence by naming me (things come into existence & lose existence by being named) > sacrifice of existence to the word (Hegel), but also consecration of existence by word: one must write, not simply be written, in order to have a name

EJQB.content: Meister Eckhart: “God becomes God when creation says God” > this assistance given (secours porté) to God by man’s writing doesn’t contradict writing’s inability to “help itself (se porter secours)” (Phaedrus)
EJQB.linkedContent: Meister Eckhart: “God becomes God when creation says God” > this assistance given (secours porté) to God by man’s writing doesn’t contradict writing’s inability to “help itself (se porter secours)” (Phaedrus)

EJQB.content: isn’t the divine, la disparition de l’homme, announced in this distress of writing?
EJQB.linkedContent: isn’t the divine, la disparition de l’homme, announced in this distress of writing?

EJQB.content: if nature refuses the leap (saut), Scripture will never be nature: proceeds by leaps alone
EJQB.linkedContent: if nature refuses the leap (saut), Scripture will never be nature: proceeds by leaps alone

EJQB.content: to write: courage to lose one’s life, to die away from nature
EJQB.linkedContent: to write: courage to lose one’s life, to die away from nature

EJQB.content: if writing isn’t a tearing of self toward other w/in a confession of infinite separation, if it takes pleasure for its own sake, it destroys itself—in plenitude, Identity, roundness of egg [cf. p. 66 Jabès renouncing verve, capriciousness]
EJQB.linkedContent: if writing isn’t a tearing of self toward other w/in a confession of infinite separation, if it takes pleasure for its own sake, it destroys itself—in plenitude, Identity, roundness of egg [cf. p. 66 Jabès renouncing verve, capriciousness]

EJQB.content: to write: to confuse ontology & grammar; grammar: in which are inscribed all dislocations of dead syntax, all aggressions perpetrated by speech against language, every questioning of the letter
EJQB.linkedContent: to write: to confuse ontology & grammar; grammar: in which are inscribed all dislocations of dead syntax, all aggressions perpetrated by speech against language, every questioning of the letter

EJQB.content: all these tortures are forgotten in literature, as mortifications, as ruses of life
EJQB.linkedContent: all these tortures are forgotten in literature, as mortifications, as ruses of life

AFR.content: Condillac against frivolous obscurantism, erudition, against philosophers (inventors of prose) who did not “witness[ ]…impressions they caused” (unlike poets, orators), nor did they find rule of their discourse in “live interchange” > frivolous style is that of the written
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac against frivolous obscurantism, erudition, against philosophers (inventors of prose) who did not “witness[ ]…impressions they caused” (unlike poets, orators), nor did they find rule of their discourse in “live interchange” > frivolous style is that of the written

D.content: in scratching (gratter) on this textual matter, your recognize description of a painting, reframed, broken into, placed in another quadrilateral, w/ one side fractured: you are painting, writing while reading: tout le tissu verbal y est pris, et vous avec
D.linkedContent: in scratching (gratter) on this textual matter, your recognize description of a painting, reframed, broken into, placed in another quadrilateral, w/ one side fractured: you are painting, writing while reading: tout le tissu verbal y est pris, et vous avec

+R.content: [Derrida on 2 hands] > to write one must be several
+R.linkedContent: [Derrida on 2 hands] > to write one must be several

LI.content: Derrida replaces “of God” w/ “of writing,” where iterability of the proof (of God) produces writing; “the perhaps it does not exist” of writing; while, w/out opposition, “God…should certainly exist”
LI.linkedContent: Derrida replaces “of God” w/ “of writing,” where iterability of the proof (of God) produces writing; “the perhaps it does not exist” of writing; while, w/out opposition, “God…should certainly exist”

LI.content: the “perhaps” of perhaps it [writing] doesn’t exist, leaves existence of writing undecidable, escapes the jurisdiction of all ontotheological discourse: the rest of the trace, its remains (restance), neither present nor absent
LI.linkedContent: the “perhaps” of perhaps it [writing] doesn’t exist, leaves existence of writing undecidable, escapes the jurisdiction of all ontotheological discourse: the rest of the trace, its remains (restance), neither present nor absent

LI.content: to no longer oppose writing to erasure (accounting for supplementary paradox) is both terrible and yet nonviolent (perhaps nonviolence itself)
LI.linkedContent: to no longer oppose writing to erasure (accounting for supplementary paradox) is both terrible and yet nonviolent (perhaps nonviolence itself)

LI.content: undecidability (not “indeterminacy”) always a determinate oscillation btwn possibilities highly determined in strictly defined structures: difference of force in decision of writing (a word whose broad sense includes political action & experience in general) > no indecision or double bind w/out determination: occasionally, each side terribly necessary & irreplaceably singular
LI.linkedContent: undecidability (not “indeterminacy”) always a determinate oscillation btwn possibilities highly determined in strictly defined structures: difference of force in decision of writing (a word whose broad sense includes political action & experience in general) > no indecision or double bind w/out determination: occasionally, each side terribly necessary & irreplaceably singular

LI.content: “double writing”: irreducible divisibility, “quasi-transcendental,” must partition itself along 2 sides of a limit and respect the rules (to certain extent) of what it deconstructs
LI.linkedContent: “double writing”: irreducible divisibility, “quasi-transcendental,” must partition itself along 2 sides of a limit and respect the rules (to certain extent) of what it deconstructs

TN.content: Nancy: writing is violent exhaustion of the discourse in which “all sense” is altered in exscribed body
TN.linkedContent: Nancy: writing is violent exhaustion of the discourse in which “all sense” is altered in exscribed body

CIN.content: btwn black & white, color of writing resembles only “literality” of cinder that still inheres in a language
CIN.linkedContent: btwn black & white, color of writing resembles only “literality” of cinder that still inheres in a language

ATAP.content: John Patmos (1: 2–3) “the joys of the reader, of the hearer/of the words of the inspiration/for those who keep what is written/yes, the time approaches”: angelic structure, condition of all marks, time, experience, writing, trace > “apocalyptic” writings: exemplary revelation of this transcendental structure
ATAP.linkedContent: John Patmos (1: 2–3) “the joys of the reader, of the hearer/of the words of the inspiration/for those who keep what is written/yes, the time approaches”: angelic structure, condition of all marks, time, experience, writing, trace > “apocalyptic” writings: exemplary revelation of this transcendental structure

ATAP.content: do not know to whom apocalyptic envoi returns, perhaps not even man is the terminal of this computer w/out end
ATAP.linkedContent: do not know to whom apocalyptic envoi returns, perhaps not even man is the terminal of this computer w/out end

CIR.content: intense relation to survival that writing is (no desire that something remain after me), to enjoy this light I’m producing through experimentation of my possible survival, i.e. of absolute death (truth of the world w/out me) [?]
CIR.linkedContent: intense relation to survival that writing is (no desire that something remain after me), to enjoy this light I’m producing through experimentation of my possible survival, i.e. of absolute death (truth of the world w/out me) [?]

CIR.content: never been able to contradict myself, still so young [cf. SW pp. 322-23], unforgettable power of my discourse—they grind even the mute ash, name of God in the ash > so I write, convenient for forgetting
CIR.linkedContent: never been able to contradict myself, still so young [cf. SW pp. 322-23], unforgettable power of my discourse—they grind even the mute ash, name of God in the ash > so I write, convenient for forgetting

SPEC.content: “the site of the legible, like the origin of writing, is carried away w/ itself (le site du lisible, comme l’origine de l’écriture, s’y emporter)”
SPEC.linkedContent: “the site of the legible, like the origin of writing, is carried away w/ itself (le site du lisible, comme l’origine de l’écriture, s’y emporter)”

SPEC.content: speculator can survive legatee of an autobiographical speculation, institution of movement w/out limit: mutism of legatee, one of the possibilities that dictates/causes legatee to write
SPEC.linkedContent: speculator can survive legatee of an autobiographical speculation, institution of movement w/out limit: mutism of legatee, one of the possibilities that dictates/causes legatee to write

SPEC.content: demon, revenance which repeats its entrance, revient w/out having been called by PP > like Socrates’ demon, which made everyone write, this automaton produces effects of ventriloquism, w/out origin, emission, addressee, tele w/out telos
SPEC.linkedContent: demon, revenance which repeats its entrance, revient w/out having been called by PP > like Socrates’ demon, which made everyone write, this automaton produces effects of ventriloquism, w/out origin, emission, addressee, tele w/out telos

SPEC.content: irresolution of scene of writing—a Bindung, tends itself (se tend), ceaseless posting, no final orgasm, beyond of pleasure remaining the end of pleasure > pleasure at its proper moment? still don’t know what it is: secousses orgasmiques, joussiance, deferred as soon as obtained
SPEC.linkedContent: irresolution of scene of writing—a Bindung, tends itself (se tend), ceaseless posting, no final orgasm, beyond of pleasure remaining the end of pleasure > pleasure at its proper moment? still don’t know what it is: secousses orgasmiques, joussiance, deferred as soon as obtained

FV.content: certain psychoanalytic interpretations (invisible framing: frame w/in frame) vs. scene of writing w/ ruined (abîmé) limits
FV.linkedContent: certain psychoanalytic interpretations (invisible framing: frame w/in frame) vs. scene of writing w/ ruined (abîmé) limits
